If there's one PC game that's almost universally recognized as a legendary gaming experience, it's Grand Theft Auto: Vice City. The game released in 2002, developed and published by Rockstar Games, is still popular today. Who doesn't love driving around a classic 80s inspired city, doing missions and causing havoc?

Grand Theft Auto: Vice City or GTAVC, is an open-world action game that brought a new level of immersion and intertwined storyline to gaming, and it took the sandbox genre to new heights. What sets Vice City apart is its setting - a fictionalized version of Miami - and its heavy 80s influences, complete with neon lights, fast cars, and rocking soundtracks.

## The Gameplay

Grand Theft Auto: Vice City is one of the most structured games in the series. The player assumes the role of Tommy Vercetti, a gangster who works for the Forelli Family. The story revolves around Vercetti as he works his way through the ranks, completing missions, and gaining power and influence.

The game's missions have a linear storyline, and it has an absolute classic popular culture b-movie vibe to everything that happens. The missions frequently involve gunfights or driving, which are the most immediately enjoyable aspects of the game.

Aside from its story mode, the game also boasts an open-world aspect, meaning that the player is free to roam around Vice City exploring it while causing chaos. You can hijack cars, kill random players, and do whatever you want in the city.

## The Soundtrack

Arguably, one of the most remarkable features of Grand Theft Auto: Vice City is its soundtrack. It perfectly encapsulates the music of the 80s, featuring over 80 authentic tracks, including popular hits such as "Billie Jean" and "I Ran (So Far Away)."

Music plays a critical role in the game's immersive experience, and the development team spent a considerable amount of time curating the playlist to create the perfect Miami Vice atmosphere. The soundtrack is available in various in-game radio stations, which adds to the realistic feel of the game.

## Verdict

Even after almost two decades since its release, Grand Theft Auto: Vice City remains an absolute classic that has managed to capture the hearts of many. It's a perfect blend of open-world exploration and structured narrative, and with its unforgettable 80s theme, it's never too late to experience the adrenaline rush that comes with cruising down Ocean Drive, running over the pesky cops chasing you.

If you're looking for a game that's intense, immersive, and just plain and simple fun, Grand Theft Auto: Vice City should definitely be on your gaming wishlist. Get your hands on the game and let yourself be transported to the colorful streets of Vice City, get lost in the thrilling action through the storyline and while exploring the streets of Vice City, you won't regret it.
